intro: Bionia coriacea, commonly known as the rough bionia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or green, with five petals and a distinctive shape. Bionia coriacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
